page.title: 11HOUSE MODERNISATION. WILLEY.
page.content: This cottage was converted in 1983 from two substandard agricultural cottages. Water had previously been delivered in churns there being neither mains supply or a well. A well was sunk, but 1984 drought conditions dried this and making a bore hole of 900 feet gave a good supply of water of 50 gallons a minute. Electicity supplies existed but septic tank drainage had to be installed. Most of the cottages had to be demolished but the stone gable end with bread oven and inglenook were kept as were existing beams, preserved by propping & shoring up whilst the external walls were built. The house is a retirement home for an architect and his wife who intend to paint and develop a hillside garden.
